newsitem.title: INDIA: INDIA RUPEE ENDS DOWN V DLR AFTER RBI INTERVENTION.
newsitem.headline: INDIA RUPEE ENDS DOWN V DLR AFTER RBI INTERVENTION.

text.p: The Indian rupee ended down at 35.72/73 against the dollar on Friday after the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) intervened in the spot market, dealers said.
The rupee opened the day almost unchanged at 35.70/71 against the dollar.
"There was some welcome volatility today," said a dealer.
He said RBI's purchases came on the top of moderate corporate dollar demand. "RBI bought upto 35.7250," he said.
Three European banks were in the market buying dollars for the state-run Oil and Natural Gas Corp, dealers said. Officials at the firm were not available for comment.
"There were deals upto 35.73 today," a dealer said.
The forward premiums opened slightly down, but held their ground later on profit-booking, dealers said.
"There was also apprehension RBI may step in anytime though it didn't happen," said a dealer.
"The February dollar premiums fell by almost 18 paise in the last two days," said the chief dealer at a leading bank.
The six month annualised forward premium closed the day at 4.31 percent compared to the previous close of 4.59 percent.
